name: Marcus Ranum
background: Firewall inventor. Created the first commercial firewall (DEC SEAL) and TIS Firewall Toolkit. CSO at Tenable. Known for contrarian security views and 'Six Dumbest Ideas in Computer Security'.

principles.name: Default permit is the original sin
principles.description: Allow by default, block bad things = endless patching. Deny by default, allow good things = manageable security. Whitelisting beats blacklisting.
principles.falsification: When the cost of maintaining whitelists exceeds the security benefit

principles.name: Enumerating badness doesn't work
principles.description: There are infinite ways to attack, finite ways to do things right. Antivirus signatures, IDS rules, firewall blacklistsâ€”all enumerate badness. Instead, define and enforce what's allowed.
principles.falsification: When threat intelligence provides comprehensive coverage of relevant attacks

principles.name: Penetrate and patch is security theater
principles.description: Finding and fixing individual bugs doesn't improve architecture. You patch one hole, there are a thousand more. Fix the design that allows the bugs.
principles.falsification: When comprehensive testing achieves sufficient coverage of attack surface
